review: I have owned this item for nearly two years now.  The product itself is typical of Apple.  It is well finished, solid and is unobtrusive in my entertainment center.  For the most part it works well.  I purchased it specifically to use with my Netflix subscription.  It worked well with Netflix until I installed an update.  Now it lags and is constantly buffering.  I even purchased a more powerful wireless router to no avail.  It is so frustrating that I really don't even use it anymore.  Before I give it away, I'm going to try hard wiring it to my router.UPDATE:  I ran a network cable from my router to the Apple TV.  Now it works like I want it to.  No more buffering or kicking me back to the menu.  I will upgrade it to 4 stars.
author: L. Tabor "regular guy"

review: I bought this thinking I could download Outlander episodes (Starz), only to realize that these versions are only available in Australia on iTunes. However, this is my first Apple product I've bought since I used to own the Apple Powerbook 100 and the Macintosh IIsi running System 6 and then System 7. Back in the early '90s these computers were on the cutting edge, but technology was moving so fast that the cutting edge didn't last long. I started out with the Roku 2 and now have the Roku 3 (really like the ability to plug earphones in to the remote). Also tried the Netgear Neo TV but gave it away as it doesn't have Amazon Instant Video. I also have the Amazon Fire TV so I'm curious to try the apple out in comparison to these other little boxes. I find that I use the Roku the most. Update: 11/11/14. Thanks to all veterans today. Okay. So I've had this little box for awhile now. Can't see the benefit when compared to my other little boxes unless I specifically want to buy a show from iTunes. The Roku 3 is still my go-to streaming box.
